data.title: Never again
data.text: Went for breakfast,they weren't even busy.Took forever just to get drinks,then other people came in behind us.They were waited on before us,got their food before us and that pretty much sets the tone for this review.The food wasn't much better than the service.

data.title: Great little cafe for lunch
data.text: We had great gumbo and open faced roast beef po-boy. Excellent. Lots of hot fries with it. Great service. No complaints.

data.title: Damn good breakfast
data.text: We actually discovered this place after leaving Tony's Brickhouse Pizza (check out my review on them🖒🖒🖒) We decided to go back the next morning and boi I'm glad we did. Breakfast was off the chain!! The wife got the Fiesta omelette and I got the Fajita Chicken omelette. Both were very good and the hash browns were cooked just right. Definitely will be going again

data.title: Great for lunch!!!!
data.text: Attended this restaurant today during lunch and my only downfall would be that it took the waitress awhile to get to my table once I walked in. I think she just didn't know I was on the other side.  However, the customer service was amazing. All of the employees were friendly and generous.  I would most definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone.

data.title: Excellent Breakfast!
data.text:
First visit to Port City Cafe - was pleasantly surprised. Arrived just after breakfast hours, yet the kitchen accommodated me - this was nice, as I was looking for breakfast fare. Ordered egg whites, sausage, bacon, and the beignets instead of the pancakes -- very nice! Airy, light, with powdered sugar. 
Chef Kurt cooked everything exactly right, and the table by the window was great.

They close at 3:00 pm, so keep that in mind :-)

data.title: Good breakfast
data.text: We had the omelets, which were very tasty. Priced a little high at $10/each (other restaurants in the area are in the $6-8 range, so not a huge difference). Service was a little slow despite being empty. Coffee is not great either. Overall a good breakfast choice.

data.title: Excellent service and very good food
data.text:
Six of us enjoyed breakfast at Port City Cafe. The food was very good and everything came out well cooked and correct the first time. The restaurant is very roomy so you are not crammed or being disturbed by others conversations.

The service from our server, Tiffany, was incredibly nice as she was really on top of her game bringing everything so quickly and making sure we had everything we needed especially for the kids.

The local decor was also interesting seeing a lot of nostalgia from the area including an amazing before and after panoramic photo of the mess caused by Katrina.

data.title: Great Family  Resturant
data.text: Way to rebuild and keep serving the family. Love your home cooked food and wonderful service. Thank You

data.title: Lunch Visit
data.text: Went to lunch today with two others; they had the Blue Plate Specials.  Good value $9 for lunch, drink and dessert.  I had a seafood pasta dish.  We can report that the food was good.  The service was also good.  Located in downtown Gulfport.  Location was perfect for our needs.  Parking was available.

data.title: Good fish tacos
data.text: We were a party of 5 for lunch. My fish tacos were very good, but the service was a little slow and our plates were served sporadically.

data.title: Just OK
data.text: Visiting from out of town and wanted a local place versus a chain. Food was priced very well $5.99 for breakfast, but as the saying goes you get what you pay for. Got our coffee first and sent two of the three coffees back. One was almost pure water and one was cold. No love in the food.  Eggs were cooked in plain oil, no flavor. Gravy was a mix. We ate everything but could have cooked better at home.

data.title: Largef than expected
data.text: We met friends here, it was our first time in Gulfport, we loved the restaurant. Our server was new but very attentive.  I ordered shrimp &grits and they were wonderful  generous portion and seasoned well. Think the other people ordered omelets, We were all happy with our food.

data.title: Breakfast.
data.text: Food was good, but don't get hash browns.  They were like deep fried  potato strings.  Plus they were barely warm.  Service was good and staff friendly.

data.title: Great Breakfast and Service!
data.text: Come in for breakfast, lunch or early dinner. For now this location is open til 3. Locally owned and conveniently located in the historic district of downtown Gulfport!

data.title: First Time
data.text: The food was very good...Service was a little slow...but we were not in a hurry..wanted to have a family gathering..Turkey club for me and my boys and the seafood platter for my husband...It was good enough we are ordering a take out today...

data.title: We had a great breakfast!
data.text: We stopped by this morning because the other restaurant was closed and these folks are open at 7:00!  The breakfast was as expected and quite good.  The staff was friendly and the service was fast.  The owner even came by as we were finishing.

data.title: Breakfast with Tiffany
data.text: Back at my favorite breakfast spot on the coast. Coffee is hot and food is great!  Thanks, Tiffany, for enhancing the experience with your humor and personality.

data.title: Not impressed
data.text: We had a group breakfast, they were out of breakfast sausage, brought our coffee in "to-go" cups because there were no clean mugs.  The wait for our eggs was over 30 minutes.

data.title: Good Old Cafe style - recommend and read why!
data.text:
We went one mid-morning.  I had the blue plate lunch came with salad, meal, drink and dessert for $6.95 I think?  My hubby had ham and cheese omelet.  Blue plate came with nice garden salad with several home made dressings to choose from (thousand island was great!), and I chose the chicken fried steak, mashed potatoes & gravy, and corn. Veggies were all tasty and fresh.  CFSteak was typical frozen but just OK.  H&C omelette was bulging with freshly cut ham and cheese and came with biscuits.  Hash browns were cut up potatoe style.  Excellent!  And all staff were extremely friendly, as we found all in Gulfport.  2 areas to dine.  Bar with TVs where there were locals already gathering for the Saint's game.  And the dining area, surrounded by Gulfport history.  I would recommend just on this.

BUT...as we were waiting we were strolling around the room looking at pictures.  Port City Café was one of the FIRST to open after the hurricane and offered delivery to those in need and were there providing services.  THAT deserves support back!!

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: Very good. Laid back atmosphere. Server Tiffany was awesome and super sweet. Definitely enjoyed our visit. This was our first time here and will definitely return in the near future
